column1: I believe there is no permanent greatness to a nation except it be based upon morality. I do not care for military greatness or military renown. I care for the condition of the people among whom I live. There is no man in England who is less likely to speak irreverently of the Crown and Monarchy of England than I am; but crowns
column12: unless with them you can have a fair share of comfort
column15: among the great body of the people. Palaces
column19: do not make a nation. The nation in every country dwells in the cottage; and unless the light of your Constitution can shine there
column20: unless the beauty of your legislation and the excellence of your statesmanship are impressed there on the feelings and condition of the people
column22: you have yet to learn the duties of government.
